message.content:
cs.SI, cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.CY 

The paper discusses conceptualizations and models of scholarly activity, which are relevant to several sub-categories of computer science. Specifically, the focus on visual manifestations suggests a connection to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), which often involves the visualization of network structures. The discussion of challenges towards a theoretically grounded and practically useful science of science suggests a connection to the sub-category of cs.DL (Digital Libraries), which deals with the organization and analysis of scholarly publications. The mention of existing work in different disciplines of science suggests a connection to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which involves the retrieval and analysis of information from various sources. The focus on frameworks for the comparison and combination of existing approaches suggests a connection to the sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), which often involves the development of conceptual frameworks for understanding user behavior. Finally, the discussion of interlinkages among the papers in the special issue suggests a connection to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society), which deals with the social and ethical implications of computer science research.
